body: Sounds like your terminal emulator doesn't support background color erase. I think it's a similar situation for travis.

For the record, I wouldn't mind removing the background color erase sequences so that our output will look better on more emulators (especially travis). The only thing that would change is the background color wouldn't stretch to the end of the window like it does here:

![bgcolor](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/306525/715899/b42d4618-df29-11e2-89f9-5e0a5cc83e33.png)

If @sebastianbergmann agrees, I should have time to do this in the next couple of days.

repository.name: php-code-coverage
repository.description: Library that provides collection, processing, and rendering functionality for PHP code coverage information.

body: I should have time for that one later today.

Alright, this should be better now. I've included some before and after screenshots below. Feedback is appreciated:

#### Black on white before:

![screen shot 2013-07-10 at 9 34 42 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/306525/774973/571de8d6-e967-11e2-8ac0-5559d927fca2.png)

### Black on white after:

![screen shot 2013-07-10 at 9 38 05 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/306525/774975/62b239ea-e967-11e2-9ac9-faafbf7b775a.png)

#### Green on black before:

![screen shot 2013-07-10 at 9 35 00 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/306525/774981/6df35992-e967-11e2-8949-695a0054ac31.png)

#### Green on black after:

![screen shot 2013-07-10 at 9 36 41 am](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/306525/774983/75f4c068-e967-11e2-95ad-8e418d48f607.png)
Also, here's an example of what code coverage looks like on travis now: https://travis-ci.org/sebastianbergmann/php-code-coverage/jobs/8926881
